Operation 'VerifySenderToken' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_context, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects, not_actionable, poor_ai_interpretability. Original summary 'Verify Sender Request' is vague and uses imprecise terminology ('Request' vs 'Identity'). Description lacks critical details: (1) what the token validates, (2) what happens upon success (state change from pending to verified), (3) what is returned, (4) the side effect of authorization. Added domain-appropriate terminology ('sender identity', 'verification token', 'pending/verified status') consistent with API context. Clarified the action and its effects for AI agent decision-making about when to use this operation.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to verify a sender requests.**

The token is generated by SendGrid and included in a verification email delivered to the address that's pending verification.
data.summary_suggestion: Verify sender identity using verification token
data.description_suggestion: Completes the sender identity verification process by validating a verification token. The token is generated by SendGrid and sent via email to the pending sender address. Upon successful verification, the sender identity becomes authorized to send email from your account. Returns the verified sender identity details. This operation transitions the sender from 'pending' to 'verified' status.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Verify Sender Request' is vague and uses imprecise terminology ('Request' vs 'Identity'). Description lacks critical details: (1) what the token validates, (2) what happens upon success (state change from pending to verified), (3) what is returned, (4) the side effect of authorization. Added domain-appropriate terminology ('sender identity', 'verification token', 'pending/verified status') consistent with API context. Clarified the action and its effects for AI agent decision-making about when to use this operation.

message: Operation 'CreateVerifiedSender' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Original summary 'Create Verified Sender Request' is vague and focuses on the request rather than the action. Description lacks clarity about required inputs and what is returned. Improved summary uses action-oriented language. Enhanced description specifies required inputs, the verification email trigger, the return value (Sender Identity object with ID), and references the resend capability for AI agent clarity.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to create a new Sender Identify**.

Upon successful submission of a `POST` request to this endpoint, an identity will be created, and a verification email will be sent to the address assigned to the `from_email` field. You must complete the verification process using the sent email to fully verify the sender.

If you need to resend the verification email, you can do so with the Resend Verified Sender Request, `/resend/{id}`, endpoint.

If you need to authenticate a domain rather than a Single Sender, see the [Domain Authentication API](https://docs.sendgrid.com/api-reference/domain-authentication/authenticate-a-domain).
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new Sender Identity for your account. Requires the sender's email address and other identity details in the request body. Upon successful creation, a verification email is sent to the specified `from_email` address. The sender must complete email verification to activate the identity. Returns the created Sender Identity object with a unique ID. Note: Use the Resend Verified Sender endpoint to resend verification emails if needed.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Create Verified Sender Request' is vague and focuses on the request rather than the action. Description lacks clarity about required inputs and what is returned. Improved summary uses action-oriented language. Enhanced description specifies required inputs, the verification email trigger, the return value (Sender Identity object with ID), and references the resend capability for AI agent clarity.

message: Operation 'UpdateVerifiedSender' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Original summary 'Edit Verified Sender' is generic. Description lacks clarity about what is returned. Improved summary uses domain-appropriate terminology ('Update' vs 'Edit'). Enhanced description emphasizes partial update capability, specifies the return value, and clarifies how to obtain required IDs for better AI agent decision-making.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to update an existing Sender Identity**.

Pass the `id` assigned to a Sender Identity to this endpoint as a path parameter. Include any fields you wish to update in the request body in JSON format.

You can retrieve the IDs associated with Sender Identities by passing a `GET` request to the Get All Verified Senders endpoint, `/verified_senders`.

**Note:** Unlike a `PUT` request, `PATCH` allows you to update only the fields you wish to edit. Fields that are not passed as part of a request will remain unaltered.
data.description_suggestion: Updates an existing Sender Identity using partial updates. Requires the Sender Identity ID as a path parameter and the fields to update in the request body. Supports partial updatesonly provided fields are modified; unspecified fields remain unchanged. Returns the updated Sender Identity object. Retrieve Sender Identity IDs using the List Verified Senders endpoint.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Edit Verified Sender' is generic. Description lacks clarity about what is returned. Improved summary uses domain-appropriate terminology ('Update' vs 'Edit'). Enhanced description emphasizes partial update capability, specifies the return value, and clarifies how to obtain required IDs for better AI agent decision-making.

message: Operation 'DeleteVerifiedSender' has semantic quality issues: missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Summary is clear and action-oriented. Description lacks information about the side effect (permanent removal and inability to send emails) and the response format. Enhanced description clarifies the permanent nature of deletion, its impact on email sending, and specifies the expected response code for AI agent clarity.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to delete a Sender Identity**.

Pass the `id` assigned to a Sender Identity to this endpoint to delete the Sender Identity from your account.

You can retrieve the IDs associated with Sender Identities using the "Get All Verified Senders" endpoint.
data.description_suggestion: Deletes a Sender Identity from your account. Requires the Sender Identity ID as a path parameter. Upon successful deletion, the Sender Identity is permanently removed and can no longer be used to send emails. Returns a 204 No Content response on success. Retrieve Sender Identity IDs using the List Verified Senders endpoint.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear and action-oriented. Description lacks information about the side effect (permanent removal and inability to send emails) and the response format. Enhanced description clarifies the permanent nature of deletion, its impact on email sending, and specifies the expected response code for AI agent clarity.

message: Operation 'ListVerifiedSenderDomain' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, unclear_purpose, missing_output_details. Original summary 'Domain Warn List' is vague and unclear. Description lacks clarity about the operation's purpose and what is returned. Improved summary uses action-oriented language and clarifies the DMARC context. Enhanced description explains the purpose (checking domain compatibility), categorizes failure types with their implications, specifies the return value, and provides use case guidance for AI agents.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint returns a list of domains known to implement DMARC and categorizes them by failure type  hard failure or soft failure**.

Domains listed as hard failures will not deliver mail when used as a [Sender Identity](https://sendgrid.com/docs/for-developers/sending-email/sender-identity/) due to the domain's DMARC policy settings.

For example, using a `yahoo.com` email address as a Sender Identity will likely result in the rejection of your mail. For more information about DMARC, see [Everything about DMARC](https://sendgrid.com/docs/ui/sending-email/dmarc/).
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a list of domains with known DMARC policies that may restrict email delivery when used as Sender Identities. Domains are categorized as hard failures (mail delivery will be rejected) or soft failures (mail delivery may be affected). Returns domain names with their failure classifications. Use this endpoint to verify if a domain is compatible with SendGrid's Sender Identity verification before creating a sender.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Domain Warn List' is vague and unclear. Description lacks clarity about the operation's purpose and what is returned. Improved summary uses action-oriented language and clarifies the DMARC context. Enhanced description explains the purpose (checking domain compatibility), categorizes failure types with their implications, specifies the return value, and provides use case guidance for AI agents.

message: Operation 'ResendVerifiedSender' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Original summary 'Resend Verified Sender Request' is vague and focuses on the request rather than the action. Description lacks information about the response and when this operation should be used. Improved summary uses action-oriented language. Enhanced description clarifies the use case (unverified senders), specifies the return value, and provides context about when to use this endpoint for better AI agent decision-making.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to resend a verification email to a specified Sender Identity**.

Passing the `id` assigned to a Sender Identity to this endpoint will resend a verification email to the `from_address` associated with the Sender Identity. This can be useful if someone loses their verification email or needs to have it resent for any other reason.

You can retrieve the IDs associated with Sender Identities by passing a "Get All Verified Senders" endpoint.
data.summary_suggestion: Resend verification email to Sender Identity
data.description_suggestion: Resends a verification email to a Sender Identity that has not yet completed the verification process. Requires the Sender Identity ID as a path parameter. The verification email is sent to the email address associated with the Sender Identity. Returns a success response confirming the email has been queued for delivery. Useful when the original verification email is lost or needs to be resent. Retrieve Sender Identity IDs using the List Verified Senders endpoint.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Resend Verified Sender Request' is vague and focuses on the request rather than the action. Description lacks information about the response and when this operation should be used. Improved summary uses action-oriented language. Enhanced description clarifies the use case (unverified senders), specifies the return value, and provides context about when to use this endpoint for better AI agent decision-making.

message: Operation 'ListVerifiedSenderStepsCompleted' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Original summary 'Completed Steps' is vague and lacks context. Description is unclear about what is returned and when to use this endpoint. Improved summary uses action-oriented language and clarifies the purpose. Enhanced description specifies the exact return fields, their meanings, and provides use case guidance for AI agents to understand when this operation is needed.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to determine which of SendGrid's verification processes have been completed for an account**.

This endpoint returns boolean values, `true` and `false`, for [Domain Authentication](https://sendgrid.com/docs/for-developers/sending-email/sender-identity/#domain-authentication), `domain_verified`, and [Single Sender Verification](https://sendgrid.com/docs/for-developers/sending-email/sender-identity/#single-sender-verification), `sender_verified`, for the account.

An account may have one, both, or neither verification steps completed. If you need to authenticate a domain rather than a Single Sender, see the "Authenticate a domain" endpoint.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves the verification status of your account's Sender Identities. Returns boolean values indicating whether Domain Authentication (`domain_verified`) and Single Sender Verification (`sender_verified`) have been completed. An account may have one, both, or neither verification steps completed. Use this endpoint to determine which verification methods are active before creating new Sender Identities.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Completed Steps' is vague and lacks context. Description is unclear about what is returned and when to use this endpoint. Improved summary uses action-oriented language and clarifies the purpose. Enhanced description specifies the exact return fields, their meanings, and provides use case guidance for AI agents to understand when this operation is needed.
